description: Numbers n such that the largest power of 3 dividing n equals 3^omega(n).
comments: "Omega(n)" here means the number of prime factors of n counted without multiplicity. = _Harvey P. Dale_, Sep 30 2015
links: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
example: omega(18)=2 and 9=3^2 is the largest power of 3 dividing 18, hence 18 is in the sequence.
author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Sep 04 2002
